documentation.text:
An interface for the metaverse core contract. This is meant
 to be used from inside the metaverse plug-ins (typically on
 plug-in initialization).

This is the list of plug-ins that are being added to the hub.
 Each contract has its separate logic but they have access to
 the same set of features. Once a contract is added, it will
 never be removed from this list. This mapping tells whether
 a contract in particular has permission(s) to define a type
 and mint tokens for an address.
This is the enumerable list of plug-ins added to this hub.
This is the count of registered plug-ins.
The linked brand registry for this metaverse.
The linked sponsor registry for this metaverse.
The linked signature verifier for this metaverse.
The linked economy for this metaverse.
Returns the type of an NFT id.

Defines the resolution of a fungible token type. The token id must be
 in the range of the fungible token ids.

Defines the resolution of a non-fungible token type. The token id must
 be in the range of the fungible token (type) ids (strictly > 0, strictly
 < (1 << 255)).
Mints a specific fungible token type, in a certain amount.

Mints many specific fungible token types, in certain amounts.
 The array of types and amounts are both nonempty and same length.

Mints a specific non-fungible token type, using a specific type (and always using
 an amount of 1). It is an error if the chosen type is unknown or < 2, since those
 types are reserved for being invalid or brands.

Mints many specific non-fungible token types, using specific types (and always using
 an amount of 1). It is an error if the chosen types are unknown or < 2, since those
 types are reserved for being invalid or brands. The token types array must not be
 empty.
Mints a specific brand token for a given user. The brand is stated as its address.

Burns a token (FT or NFT, except for brands) on a given amounts.
 NFT will always use an amount of 1.

Burns many tokens (FTs or NFTs, expect for brands) on given amounts.
 NFTs will always be burned in an amount of 1.

Retrieves the metadata uri of a given token. WARNING: This method
 will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a
 CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other
 contract's code).

Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155 when a brand NFT
 is transferred.

Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155 when another type
 of NFT is transferred.

Tells whether a user has a specific permission on the metaverse, or
 is its owner.

Checks a signature. Returns the validated hash and sender address.
 The delegation must be a pack of (sender, stamp, hash, signature),
 and the stamp is checked against the timeout.
Checks that a brand is sponsored by a certain sponsor.

An interface for the metaverse core contract. This is meant
 to be used from inside the metaverse plug-ins (typically on
 plug-in initialization).

This is the list of plug-ins that are being added to the hub.
 Each contract has its separate logic but they have access to
 the same set of features. Once a contract is added, it will
 never be removed from this list. This mapping tells whether
 a contract in particular has permission(s) to define a type
 and mint tokens for an address.
This is the enumerable list of plug-ins added to this hub.
This is the count of registered plug-ins.
The linked brand registry for this metaverse.
The linked sponsor registry for this metaverse.
The linked signature verifier for this metaverse.
The linked economy for this metaverse.
Returns the type of an NFT id.

Defines the resolution of a fungible token type. The token id must be
 in the range of the fungible token ids.

Defines the resolution of a non-fungible token type. The token id must
 be in the range of the fungible token (type) ids (strictly > 0, strictly
 < (1 << 255)).
Mints a specific fungible token type, in a certain amount.

Mints many specific fungible token types, in certain amounts.
 The array of types and amounts are both nonempty and same length.

Mints a specific non-fungible token type, using a specific type (and always using
 an amount of 1). It is an error if the chosen type is unknown or < 2, since those
 types are reserved for being invalid or brands.

Mints many specific non-fungible token types, using specific types (and always using
 an amount of 1). It is an error if the chosen types are unknown or < 2, since those
 types are reserved for being invalid or brands. The token types array must not be
 empty.
Mints a specific brand token for a given user. The brand is stated as its address.

Burns a token (FT or NFT, except for brands) on a given amounts.
 NFT will always use an amount of 1.

Burns many tokens (FTs or NFTs, expect for brands) on given amounts.
 NFTs will always be burned in an amount of 1.

Retrieves the metadata uri of a given token. WARNING: This method
 will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a
 CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other
 contract's code).

Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155 when a brand NFT
 is transferred.

Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155 when another type
 of NFT is transferred.

Tells whether a user has a specific permission on the metaverse, or
 is its owner.

Checks a signature. Returns the validated hash and sender address.
 The delegation must be a pack of (sender, stamp, hash, signature),
 and the stamp is checked against the timeout.
Checks that a brand is sponsored by a certain sponsor.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

brandRegistry().notice: The linked brand registry for this metaverse.

burnToken(uint256,uint256).notice: Burns a token (FT or NFT, except for brands) on a given amounts. NFT will always use an amount of 1.

burnTokens(uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Burns many tokens (FTs or NFTs, expect for brands) on given amounts. NFTs will always be burned in an amount of 1.

checkSignature(bytes,bytes32,uint256).notice: Checks a signature. Returns the validated hash and sender address. The delegation must be a pack of (sender, stamp, hash, signature), and the stamp is checked against the timeout.

checkSponsoring(address,address).notice: Checks that a brand is sponsored by a certain sponsor.

defineNextFTType(address).notice: Defines the resolution of a fungible token type. The token id must be in the range of the fungible token ids.

defineNextNFTType().notice: Defines the resolution of a non-fungible token type. The token id must be in the range of the fungible token (type) ids (strictly > 0, strictly < (1 << 255)).

economy().notice: The linked economy for this metaverse.

isAllowed(bytes32,address).notice: Tells whether a user has a specific permission on the metaverse, or is its owner.

mintBrandFor(address,address).notice: Mints a specific brand token for a given user. The brand is stated as its address.

mintFTFor(address,uint256,uint256,bytes).notice: Mints a specific fungible token type, in a certain amount.

mintFTsFor(address,uint256[],uint256[],b.notice: Mints many specific fungible token types, in certain amounts. The array of types and amounts are both nonempty and same length.

mintNFTFor(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Mints a specific non-fungible token type, using a specific type (and always using an amount of 1). It is an error if the chosen type is unknown or < 2, since those types are reserved for being invalid or brands.

mintNFTsFor(address,uint256[],bytes).notice: Mints many specific non-fungible token types, using specific types (and always using an amount of 1). It is an error if the chosen types are unknown or < 2, since those types are reserved for being invalid or brands. The token types array must not be empty.

nftTypes(uint256).notice: Returns the type of an NFT id.

onBrandOwnerChanged(address,address).notice: Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155 when a brand NFT is transferred.

onNFTOwnerChanged(uint256,address).notice: Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155 when another type of NFT is transferred.

plugins(address).notice: This is the list of plug-ins that are being added to the hub. Each contract has its separate logic but they have access to the same set of features. Once a contract is added, it will never be removed from this list. This mapping tells whether a contract in particular has permission(s) to define a type and mint tokens for an address.

pluginsCount().notice: This is the count of registered plug-ins.

pluginsList(uint256).notice: This is the enumerable list of plug-ins added to this hub.

signatureVerifier().notice: The linked signature verifier for this metaverse.

sponsorRegistry().notice: The linked sponsor registry for this metaverse.

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Retrieves the metadata uri of a given token. WARNING: This method will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other contract's code).

userdoc.notice: An interface for the metaverse core contract. This is meant to be used from inside the metaverse plug-ins (typically on plug-in initialization).
